subNodes.conversationText: root

"Well, good on you! You didn't cut her head off exactly, not like I was hoping for, but it was close enough. You've done me a bit of a favor so you can have these potions. I don't need them. Not where I'm going."

The imp grins. "So that's it then!" 

A red glow forms around the imp as it gates back to its own dimension.
Continue
"Ahh, hey. You again."
"What are you doing here?"

"Just keeping an eye on things. You might want to be careful around here, by the way. There are nasty blood experiments all over the place, and I don't want you getting yourself dead before you've cut Azzerakin's head off."
"Just keep out of my way."
"Do you have anything to trade?"
"Back again? She isn't dead yet, you know. You might want to get on with that."
"I had some questions."
"So, what do you want to know?"

Ahead of you is a small, winged creature with sharp talons and cruel eyes.

"Well, well, well! What have we here?"
"I am <FullName>. Who are you?"
The creature performs a little mid-air caper, a little like a mocking bow. "You can call me Xix. I am currently in the employ of Azzerakin, which you will think makes us enemies. Yes?"
"Not necessarily. Tell me about Azzerakin."

"Azzerakin is a powerful necromancer. She's thoroughly evil, and getting quite mad to go with it these days." The imp pauses. "Really, you'd really expect that I'd get on with her better than I do. But I can't stand her."

"Anyway, the undead here are her doing. Most of them were happy and alive not that long ago, until she got her twisted little hands on them."
Continue
"So, what do you want to know?"
"Why is she here?"

"She's looking for eternal life. Imagine that!" The imp cartwheels in the air. "She's bad enough now, but imagine being stuck with her for all eternity! What a nightmare. I hope someone sticks a pointy end in her before then. I imagine that's part of your plan, yes?"
"Will you help me?"

The imp laughs. "By the Seas of Flame, no! Why would I help you, <Race>? Firstly, I'm bound to Azzerakin by magic, so I can't. But even if I could, I wouldn't. I only met you five minutes ago and I already can't stand you. I'm quite looking forward to watching her burn you alive, to be honest."
"Watch your mouth, imp!"
"If it helps, I'll enjoy it just as much if you cut her head off." The imp grins. "Consider me a neutral observer who just enjoys the mayhem."
"I want to ask about something else."
"So, what do you want to know?"
"I want to ask about something else."
"So, what do you want to know?"
"Do you know what is below the temple?"
"Oh, yes. Yes I do."
"Well, what is it?"
The imp shudders. "Its nasty. Let's just say you don't want to go down there."
"I want to ask about something else."
"So, what do you want to know?"
"Why are you working for her? You clearly hate her."
"I'm bound to her by magic. Until she gets herself killed, I do what she wants."
"I could kill her for you."
"You do that. Then come and talk to me." The imp rubs its talons together, and gives you a cruel look. "When I am unbound.... well, then I can do things to you. I mean, for you."
"What has she got you doing down here?"
"She's made this level into her living quarter. I'm studying some artifacts for her whilst she's working below."
"What artifacts?"

The imp gives you a look of amusement.

"Artifacts.... special artifacts. You wouldn't understand."
"I want to ask about something else."
"So, what do you want to know?"
"Do you know anything about Elderin Stones?"
"I know you don't have one."
"Do you know where I could find one?"
"Yes."
"...but you're not going to tell me?"

The imp laughs. "No, I'll tell you. Azzerakin has one. She thinks it forms part of the process to give her eternal life. She's a bit simple sometimes."

"You'll have to prise it from her cold fingers though, she won't give it up easily."
"I want to ask about something else."
"So, what do you want to know?"
"Have you come across someone called Dalamar?"

The imp's eye's narrow deviously.

"No."
"You're lying."

The imp laughs. "There's just no pulling the sheets over your face! You're much, much cleverer than I am."

"Yes, I know Dalamar. He's Azzerakin's apprentice. Or at least that's what he claims. He arrived after her and he keeps out of her way most of them time. He's down in the Crypts, I think. You should talk to him."
"Why are you telling me this now?"
"Because I changed my mind."
"I want to ask you about something else."
"So, what do you want to know?"
"I want to ask about something else."
"So, what do you want to know?"
"Can you do anything for me?"
"If you have any gold, I could trade you a few items. Are you interested?"
"Yes. Show me."
"No. I want to ask about something else."
"So, what do you want to know?"
"I'll leave you for the minute."
